(c) Fannius. Gaius Fannius Strabo, also a son-inlaw of Laelius, was a soldier, statesman, and writer. He was among the first to enter 'Carthage when it was captured by Scipio in 146 nc, and later served in Spain under Fabius in the war against Viriathus He attained the consulship in 122 rac. He wrote of the wars in which he participated and of the trouble with the Gracchi. Cicero criticises his style, but a fragment of Sallust commends his accuracy.

7. Scipio. In the de Amicitia Laelius, for the most part, presents the views of his friend, P. Cornelius Scipio, who was the younger son of Lucius Aemilius Paulus. Upon his adoption by P.
